message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the problem of unbiased data collection for personalization and recommender systems, which falls under the information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also introduces a novel Thompson sampling method for Bernoulli ranked-list, which is a type of reinforcement learning algorithm commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper emphasizes the importance of user experience and engagement, which relates to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the downstream impact of biased data on various tasks, including content classification, which falls under the social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
